snippet: Albert Woodfox, who has spent most of four decades in solitary for the 1972 murder of a prison guard, has been indicted three times, tried twice, convicted twice — and had both convictions thrown out.
abstract: Albert Woodfox, who has been in solitary confinement in Louisiana State Penitentiary for 43 years for 1972 murder of prison guard Brent Miller, is facing possibility of release after Judge James J Brady rules he should not face third trial for murder; Woodfox's convictions in previous two trials have been thrown out, but state is still fighting to keep him in jail.
lead_paragraph: Albert Woodfox, who has spent most of four decades in solitary for the 1972 murder of a prison guard, has been indicted three times, tried twice, convicted twice — and had both convictions thrown out.

headline.main: On Tortuous Road to Freedom, ‘Angola Three’ Inmate Bides His Time
headline.print_headline: Inmate Edges Close to Freedom, but Louisiana Won’t Let Go
